title: signing in to firefox sync
content: I reset my computer. When I reloaded Firefox and tried to sync my bookmarks and passwords, the password I had written down to sync into my Firefox account did not work. I saw that if I reset it, my bookmarks and passwords MIGHT be lost. Then I discovered it was possible to create a Recovery Key to retrieve them, but guess what, you had to sign in to your account to get one, which, of course, I could not. I tried to find a help phone number, but you guessed it, no luck. I then took the chance and changed my password and all of my passwords and bookmarks are gone. Would it not be possible to talk to someone who could help me access the passwords and bookmarks? They must still be on a server somewhere.

title: About:config Printer Settings won't save
content: I have a regular printer and a label printer (4x6inch) attached to my office computer. It won't save when I save these two sizes. How do I set this to be 11x8.5 by default and not change back after I use my label printer? Thanks so much, this is very annoying. I've tried changing printer settings to no avail.

title: Printer settings keep getting reset - (and two other problems, possibly related)
content:
Just recently, Firefox starting printing web pages quite huge, so that only about 1/4 of a page fit on a printed page. It's not what I specify (for example, I specify fit to width (or something like that). So I learned about deleting the printer preferences in about:config. But then it happened again twice more. When it is working correctly, the print dialogue box looks like a normal windows one (see attached). When it is working incorrectly, the dialogue box looks quite different (I don't have a screenshot of that, sorry). I'd like this to stop happening. (And yes, that screenshot confirms that I still play Freecell, 25 years later.)

Another thing is that every time I start Firefox, it asks if I want it to be the default printer. But every time I do set it to be the default, but it still asks the next time.

The third is that whenever I restart FF (or most of the times I restart [and I rarely do restart it except when I reboot]), many websites think I'm coming from a new computer. I assume this has something to do with cookies, but I allow cookies and certainly if I go to that site a second time w/o restarting, it recognizes the computer.

One other quirky behavior - if I've rebooted, often after I've opened FF, then if I click on a link in an email, say, it opens another instance, but once I've closed the first instance, then it returns to normal behavior of opening all links in the same instance. (I mention all of these in case they are somehow related - although I'd like to get solutions to any.)

Any help on these issues (the default one is an extremely minor inconvenience; the other two are far more of an inconvenience) would be greatly appreciated.
creator: zarky1

title: Amazon previews broken since last update
content:
Since the last update, the previews on Amazon product listings don't work. You click and nothing happens. Normally, you can click on the main pic, another window overlays the main window, and then you can scroll through more pictures of the product. Or, you can click on the thumbnails and look at those on the main page.

None of it works now. I thought it must be an extension, even though I hadn't installed anything recently. But I restarted in safe mode, and same problem.

I really rely on these previews when considering a purchase at Amazon. I contacted Amazon support, and like everyone else, they told me to use Chrome.

While I'm at it, I wish companies that have issues on Firefox would STOP telling me to use Chrome. I don't like it and I shouldn't be expected to use it. If I went into the grocery and found the carrots all moldy, then asked the manager if they had fresher carrots because I'm a vegetarian, what would you say when the manager said, "We have plenty of fresh ground lamb, try that."

That's what it feels like. /rant

Any ideas? The preview feature *does* work on other browsers, but I'd rather eat carrots.
creator: Blahdidah

title: webdeveloper tool - Inspector not working
content:
The inspector tool isn't working (prior to restarting)

I searched the question on google, and found a closed ticket from 2016, where I tried the different solutions provided by the support staff without any effects. Opening a new firefox window fixed the problem along with, opening inspector in other tabs, swapping between with open tabs with inspector open isn't an issue.

Only the specifc tab I've been working on for a few hours that have stopped working and causes issues (sort off I guess).

Opening my local development in another tab / window didn't reproduce the problem, so I guess some bottleneck has happened over time with extensive refresh and dom updates (Was working with styling atm).

Anyway, as off posting this question, I plan on closing my defect tab, and use the other development tab I recently used for testing the bug related problem.

reference: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1112797
creator: alexander.enetoft.lawaetz

title: Firefox's not referring to 'next pages'
content:
Yesterday I needed to print out a 2 page set of labels sent to me by Ebay to return something. My printer would only print the 2nd page, over, and over again. I never was able to print the first page of the labels with the address on it in order to return the item.

I suddenly twigged that Firefox has something that stops it referring to another page, and went to another browser in order to get my printing job done.

However I'd rather use Firefox for all things, so how do I overcome Firefox not allowing me to load and print the second page of labels/ refer to another page when I give it permission to? How do I give FF permission to refer to other pages in certain circumstances?

content:

There's a check box on their dialogue box which of course I'm not going to tick, but at the bottom the only option is to press "I agree" button. There is no "save my choice" option. So I want to know if I click the I agree button whether I'm still agreeing to the check box as well? There seems no way round this, there's no crossing out of this I agree to all cookies dialogue box, I would have to not use FB at all instead. Any insights, or workarounds anyone?

I'm running Windows 10 and Firefox 82.02

title: Error "Hmm. We’re having trouble finding that site." with https://app.powerbi.com
content:
Hi,

I have a problem with my Firefox with https://app.powerbi.com which display the following error : "Hmm. We’re having trouble finding that site."

This is not a DNS problem, the website works with an other navigator. I tried :

  • Create a new profile
  • restart with addons disabled
  • Private navigation
  • Disable Network.dns.disablePrefetch

The only clue I have is that the dns of this website is a cname of an cname

$ dig A app.powerbi.com ...

ANSWER SECTION:

app.powerbi.com. 2678 IN CNAME app.privatelink.analysis.windows.net.

app.privatelink.analysis.windows.net. 6278 IN CNAME 997de1ee-c405-4364-8b90-eb6f601a6af2.trafficmanager.net. 997de1ee-c405-4364-8b90-eb6f601a6af2.trafficmanager.net. 98 IN CNAME pbi-wfe-france-central-primary.powerbi.com. pbi-wfe-france-central-primary.powerbi.com. 2678 IN CNAME pbi-wfe-france-central-primary-ase.powerbi.com. pbi-wfe-france-central-primary-ase.powerbi.com. 2678 IN CNAME app-pbi-wfe-france-central-primary.pbi-wfe-france-central-primary-ase.p.azurewebsites.net. app-pbi-wfe-france-central-primary.pbi-wfe-france-central-primary-ase.p.azurewebsites.net. 30 IN CNAME waws-prod-par-d629a594.sip.p.azurewebsites.windows.net. waws-prod-par-d629a594.sip.p.azurewebsites.windows.net. 878 IN CNAME waws-prod-par-d629a594.cloudapp.net. waws-prod-par-d629a594.cloudapp.net. 10 IN A 20.188.62.139


Some information :

OS : $ cat /etc/debian_version bullseye/sid

Kernel : $ uname -a Linux 5.9.0-1-amd64 #1 SMP Debian 5.9.1-1 (2020-10-17) x86_64 GNU/Linux

Firefox version : I tried with firefox and firefox-esr ii firefox 75.0-2 amd64 Mozilla Firefox web browser ii firefox-esr 78.3.0esr-2 amd64 Mozilla Firefox web browser - Extended Support Release (ESR)

Thanks, Jonathan

title: Firefox is suddenly and randomly shutting down for me as well.
content: Firefox just shuts down and when you reopen it the result is as others have reported - it lists the tabs that were open and you have to wait for the pages to rewrite. Some revert back to a log in screen but most go back to the screen when Firefox shuts down. There are no issues that are evident and nothing comes up in the alerts on my AV, etc. programs. It is really annoying when you have just logged into a mail program e. g. hotmail; aim; and it is in the private browser screen. This one does not reopen and you have to start from the beginning again. It has only been happening over the last week or so and can happen 2 or 3 times in a day, depending on how long the computer is being used - extended day or just a short few hours. There are no crash reports or error messages from Firefox. It just totally shuts down.
creator: ok007au

title: Firefox is blocking requests to a particular url on react app

Also to be noted is that this happens only with one particular project and not with other projects. The same API works fine on Chrome.

title: Firefox & Collections
content:
Brandon Armstrong

xxxxxxxxx@xxxx.xxx xxxxxxx.xx.xx.xxxxx.xxx

Hi, I have a cheap Obama phone, ul40 and I only get 2G a month, it is several years old. So I will go to a free public WiFi place, spend a few hours downloading, then I go home and use a USB cable to transfer them to my old Dell home PC.

My phone has been acting up, so I factory reset it. I installed the Firefox browser, I like it because I could save web pages as a PDF.

I installed the new Firefox and had some problems. I saved a bunch of items, but when I linked to my PC there was only one item in downloads, everything else was now in Collections. Collections was new to me and I thought it was just labeling things.

(email address removed by moderator; please do not post personal information on a public website) I will check my phone's memory, I have dozens of items in Collections, I tap them and I can read the articles, but I can't seem to access them from my PC.

How do do this? Is there a way to go back to the previous...print, save as PDF, method? It seems like you fixed something that wasn't broken.

Frankly I don't know why there isn't a Save/Download button on display at all times when you see something interesting. What is the logic in starting to Print something, than previewing it, then saving the preview?

Sorry if I seem a bit irritated. Is it simply time to apply for a new phone?

Thanks, BA
creator: brandon.la.70

title: Since installing the late October update I'm having display issues in Newspaper (NYT and WaPo) sites.
content: The width of news columns have shrunk, and side columns like comments in New York Times have lost both width and height and are in smaller fonts. I normally run most web pages at 120-150% and the larger size seems to not passing on to the side columns. The column width issue also occurs on the Washington Post. The only change has been the Firefox update, and standard rebooting and troubleshooting makes no difference. I need to get back to the previous column and text sizes, including applying increased magnification. Is there any option short of trying to revert to the older version, which doesn't look easy.
creator: amoret

title: Firefox Window Position on Open
content: Why is it when I move the Firefox window to touch the taskbar, when I close and reopen Firefox, there is a 4-5px gap between the window border and the taskbar? This triggers my mild OCD like no other. Other browsers don't have this issue - so why Firefox?

title: Recover Deleted Firefox Browsing History
content:
Regarding "Recover Deleted Firefox Browsing History"

I ran CCleaner software and it deleted all my history on general PC Health checkup & fix without my knowledge it would do so. I need to get them back. I use Windows 7 Home Premium.

I have reviewed the answers given on this by helpers back in July 2020 but I am unclear on where to find the index.dat file they mention. The instructions given there about going thru START etc and changing what files are visible on C drive I assume relate to Windows folder options ??????? Yes / No ? (Where is this Start button because the bottom left of screen one doesnt run the search sequence they mentioned).

Exactly what folder is the backup saved index.dat file in ?

Then using the index.dat viewer which file do I copy its information to ?

Can someone give a clear concise step by step description on recovery of the lost browsing history.

I would also comment Firefox ought to have an recovery button for accidentally deleted history to save having to go thru all this
creator: superguy55
